fund which tracks the S&P 500 which is a

companies in the US is your best bet it

not one stock individually but the

put your money into the US Stock Market
something like an index fund that tracks

there's never been in a case where the
market crashed in the US and did not

there's a major which is more than a 20%

one of these crashes comes around the

oh no that the US economy is about to
tank warning everyone to take their
money out and guess what happens the
people who take their money out well
they lock in their losses they lose that

only do they see their Fortune recover

chances of you investing money and still
be at a loss if you invested any time in
the past 150 years if you invested and
kept your money in for only 10 years you
had a 12% chance of losing money if you
kept your money in for 15 years you had
a 5% chance if you kept your money in
for 20 years you only had a
0.6% chance of losing money and if you
kept your money in for 25 years you had
a 0% chance of losing money that means
even if you were the most unlucky
investor on this planet and you invested
at the worst time possible such as right
before the Great Depression if you kept
your money in for more than 25 years
you'd still come out positive lesson
three is to Diversified diversifying
